content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

For example, if `dt` is "2019-04-30T12:05:30.687", then the new column `ym` should be 201904.

<codeblock id="04_11">

- You can extract year and month from a DateTime with [`year`](https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/stdlib/Dates/#Dates.year) and [`month`](https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/stdlib/Dates/#Dates.month), respectively.
- You can concatenate strings with `*`.
- You can create a new column in an existing DataFrame using `df[!, :newcolname] = ...` and replace the `...` by your implementation.

</codeblock>
